para.text: Purpose. The purpose of the post-election verification and audit program is to:
Demonstrate and confirm the accuracy of the voting system’s tabulation logic;
Ensure that each accepted vote-by-mail ballot and provisional ballot met the acceptance criteria and conversely that rejected ballots did not meet the criteria; and
Confirm that the number of ballots cast in a voting center equals the number of voters who checked in to vote at the voting center;
The State Administrator shall establish a post-election verification and audit program for special elections conducted by mail.
A local board shall perform the post-election verification and audit developed by the State Administrator.

section.heading: Release of Voting System.
section.text: Once secured, as required by COMAR 33.10, no part of the voting system may be released except:

para.text: As specifically authorized by law; or
On the written authorization of the:
State Administrator for State contests; or
